release.action: - Changed nethod signatures from Object[] to java.util.Collection.
Changed signatures on PicoContainer from registerComponent to more verbose method names.
Fixed PICO-20 - Merge default lifecycle interfaces into one.
Fixed PICO-21 - Change package name from picocontainer to org.picocontainer.
Fixed PICO-28 - Merge PicoInstantiationException and PicoIntrospectionException.
Fixed PICO-29 - Rename AggregatedContainersContainer to CompositePicoContainer.
Fixed PICO-31 - Make getAggregateComponentProxy() an interface method on PicoContainer.
Fixed PICO-32 - Support multiple implementations of same service.
Factored out logic for creation of aggregating proxy for a container's components. This opens up for alternative implementations using e.g. cglib.
Factored out default dependency-handling algorithms into pluggable Parameter-strategies. This opens up for multiple implementations, parameters configured from properties-files and so on.
Refactored the ComponentFactory interface so that IoC type 3 (based on constructors) is no longer mandatory.
A Bean-style component factory is provided for components implemented as Java Beans. (Empty constructors and setXxx methods taking one argument).
ImplementationHindingComponentFactory is now a decorator rather than a subclsss of the default one, making it usable in conjunction with any other ComponentFactory.
Improved the getAggregateComponentProxy method so that when a method is called on the proxy, the returned value will also be a proxy that aggregates.

Added optional lifecycle interfaces and LifecyclePicoContainer in org.picocontainer.lifecycle. This package is optional, and can be used as inspiration for implementation of other containers that handle lifecycle transparently with extra methods on the container.
